programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Relive Super Bowl XXIX where Steve Young was able to put to rest any questions about his credentials to take over the 49ers after Joe Montana was traded away in 1993. programme.title: Super Bowl Classic Games
programme.desc: Relive Super Bowl XXIX where Steve Young was able to put to rest any questions about his credentials to take over the 49ers after Joe Montana was traded away in 1993. Young set a Super Bowl record with 6 touchdown passes en route to the 49ers' fifth Super Bowl victory, the first team in NFL history to win that many. 49ers defensive back Deion Sanders intercepted backup quarterback Gale Gilbert's fourth-down pass in the end zone.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: 10/15/86: The Astros scored three runs in the 1st inning and took the lead deep into the 9th, until the Mets retaliated with three runs to send the game into extras. Fast forward to the top of the 16th when Ray Knights hit a go-ahead knock and the rest is history!

programme.title: wsop-2024-be-ev-55-250k-nlh-shr-day3
programme.desc: Watch the final table of Event #55: $250,000 Super High Roller from the 2024 World Series of Poker.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 1
programme.desc: The first of three festive Poker After Dark nights headlined by Phil Hellmuth featured jolly $10000 Sit & Go! Rewatch the full show as Hellmuth took on Maria Ho Antonio Esfandiari Mike Matusow Dan Shak and Randall Emmett.

programme.title: Poker After Dark Holidays with Hellmuth Day 2
programme.desc: The festivities continue on Holidays with Hellmuth as Phil takes on all comers in this $100/$200 cash game. Rewatch the whole show now as he goes up against Dan Shak Brian Potashnik David 'Doc' Sands Avi Freedman and Rick Thompson.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker After Dark
programme.desc: Take an intimate look at one table as it develops over a week of play. The world's best players come together to play a single-table tournament or cash game as your favorite players look to beat the best on Poker After Dark.

programme.desc: Four women escape from a prison work detail, and an inmate informs Nash to tell him their plans.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: A murder victim plants “key” evidence on Joe, and Nash and Joe on collision course with a mobster.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash’s investigation into the murder of the Chief of Police puts him in conflict with the DEA.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash goes undercover in Las Vegas to track down the Chief of Police killer.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: A mad bomber forces Nash to choose between saving Cassidy or Joe.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Cassidy goes undercover to infiltrate a dangerous diamond smuggling ring.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash’s old flame Tamara is back and tangled up in an FBI investigation.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash must stop a gang of thieves terrorizing San Francisco’s high society.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: A DEA warehouse is robbed and it’s up to the SIU to retrieve the stolen cocaine.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Cassidy investigates a fraternity’s member’s suspicious death.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash has to stop a bunch of wealthy slackers from killing each other for sport.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash and Joe are trapped in a building that’s about to explode.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash tries to protect a TV reporter stalked by a murderous maniac.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Tony B needs Nash’s help when he fakes his own death.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash and an AWOL Canadian Mountie battle bears and bad guys.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash has to prove Rachel’s innocence when she is framed for murder.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Tamara’s back claiming to be married to Nash, while Nick crossed paths with a dangerous gangster.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: Nash’s buddy Rick involves him in a deadly dispute with an angry Miami drug dealer.

programme.title: Nash Bridges
programme.desc: A suspect is in custody for a shooting, but Nash knows they've arrested the wrong man.

programme.title: The Undefeated
programme.desc: After the Civil War, ex-Confederates heading to Mexico clash with Union cavalrymen, but they must unite to defeat Mexican bandits and revolutionaries.

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: Heartless tycoon Bart Jason (Edward Asner) hires a group of thugs to force the MacDonald family out of El Dorado so he can claim their land. J.P. Harrah, the town's sheriff, is too deep in the throes of alcoholism to help the family. When Harrah's friend, noble elder gunfighter Cole Thorton (John Wayne), learns of the predicament, he travels to El Dorado with his upstart friend, Mississippi (James Caan), to help Harrah clean up in time for a shootout against Jason's men.

programme.title: The Comancheros
programme.desc: After his partner is killed, aging Texas Ranger Jake Cutter (John Wayne) is assigned to capture gambler Paul Regret (Stuart Whitman), a condemned prisoner who managed to escape hanging, and return him to Louisiana to face his sentence. But once Cutter has him in custody, they encounter the Comancheros, a fierce band of outlaws providing guns and booze to the Comanches, and are forced to work together to stop them. When Regret proves his worth in the fight, Cutter begins to reevaluate his duties.

programme.title: Rio Bravo
programme.desc: When gunslinger Joe Burdette (Claude Akins) kills a man in a saloon, Sheriff John T. Chance (John Wayne) arrests him with the aid of the town drunk, Dude (Dean Martin). Before long, Burdette's brother, Nathan (John Russell), comes around, indicating that he's prepared to bust his brother out of jail if necessary. Chance decides to make a stand until reinforcements arrive, enlisting Dude, an old cripple named Stumpy (Walter Brennan) and baby-faced cowboy Colorado Ryan (Ricky Nelson) to help.

programme.title: Tall in the Saddle
programme.desc: Cowboy Rocklin (John Wayne) rides into a dusty western township where he's been promised work on a ranch. But when he finds that his future boss has been gunned down, he's forced to find work elsewhere. Despite his sexist attitudes, Rocklin charms the fiery Arly (Ella Raines) with his cavalier bravado and lands a job at her family's ranch. There, however, he learns that Judge Garvey (Ward Bond) was involved in his original employer's murder and is now trying to steal the dead man's land.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: An embittered Indian scout attempts to escort a homesteader's wife and her son back to safety after her cowardly husband deserts her during an Apache attack. When she refuses to go, the scout stays on to help for a while and, over time, forms a strong bond with both her and her son.

programme.title: The Valley of Gwangi
programme.desc: A Wild West showman (James Franciscus) and his cowboys find dinosaurs near a Mexican town and put one on display.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho come to the aid of a lady rancher fighting a greedy cattle baron who's making ranchers and drovers pay him for watering their herds.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho are forced to switch clothes with two escaped convicts and are later arrested when they are mistaken for the fleeing criminals.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho find themselves being shot at by a quick-tempered young man who has found oil on his ranch and thinks that they're trying to take it from him.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho come to the rescue of a wild stallion accused of stealing a girl's mares.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: After a robbery by the Doolin gang, Matt interviews a mortally wounded Ed Brinkley regarding the Doolin hideout in Oklahoma. Frankie shows up pretending to be Ed's widow.

programme.title: The Last of the Mohicans
programme.desc: Based on a book by James Fenimore Cooper.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: In order to be with her outlaw lover, Little Britches turns outlaw, and the two rob a bank. Matt investigates the bank robbery and gives chase with Frankie.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Black Jack Ketchum is a wanted outlaw in two countries. He lies low at the Cullen Ranch in 1890's New Mexico. Matt and Frankie head to the area to stop the gang's activities.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie see Matt's old friend Tom Horn while investigating a cattle dispute in Wyoming. When a young homesteader is killed the detectives see evidence add up against Horn.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Frankie arrive in Austin in the 1880's to investigate the background of Ben Thompson. Matt gets employment at a gambling den owned by Ben's ex Texas.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Hollister risks his life to rescue the governor, who has been kidnapped by a gang.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Belle Reed's sister poses as her, with hopes of trapping her killer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas develops temporary amnesia from a head injury while visiting a strange town and mistakenly assumes the identity of a wanted criminal.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A former neighbor of the McCains' is released from jail after serving his sentence for robbery. Lucas lets the man work for him but the new hand holds a secret.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Lucas, Mark, and Micah get lost in Old Mexico, they are held hostage by a group of bandits who intend to kill the men and take Mark as a slave.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: While trapped in the ghost town saloon, Lucas tries to come up with a plan to escape with his son and Micah after Mark refuses to leave without him.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Pirate queen Coco LaSalle convinces Yancy to back her fighter against the mighty heavyweight called the Tennessee Slasher. While Derringer organizes the illegal fight away from the city administrator's prying eyes, he also searches for a cache of Spencer repeating rifles recently stolen from the federal armory at Port Hudson.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: When John Colton is promoted and ordered back to Washington, General Wheeler takes his place with orders to break up a nation-wide counterfeiting gang that is based in New Orleans. However, Yancy objects to General Wheeler's tactics of investigation, particularly the raiding of every gambling house in the city, putting him at odds with the new administrator.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat encounters a judge up for reelection in Headstone, Texas, and bets on an exhibition fight.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat bungles an attempt to thwart stagecoach robbers, resulting in the disappearance of precious silver bullion and the stagecoach itself.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: An imprisoned gunfighter is offered freedom for fighting outlaws.

programme.title: Zane Grey Theater
programme.desc: A killing and a father's desire for revenge ruins a love affair.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is threatened with hanging by a lynch party when some horses he has purchased in a neighboring town turn out to be stolen.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A janitor-turned-gunfighter's reputation hangs on one lucky shot and a lot of gall. The handyman finds himself in trouble when he accidentally kills another gunfighter.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas is out for vengeance when Mark is used as a pawn in a bank robbery scheme.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas shoots a horse thief who turns out to be a member of the Boyle clan. Now Ma Boyle is after him.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When Mark finds gold on their property, a fast-talking salesman who tried to sell Lucas a new lightning rod offers instead to buy the ranch's mineral rights.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas tracks an escaped prisoner to a town that turns out to be run by the gunman's brother who is notorious for shooting people in the back.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: When an outlaw leader lures Marshall Torrance out of town, Only Lucas can stop him from lynching a local man who killed one of the members of his gang.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark and his friend become trapped in an old mine.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark attempt to reform a con-man.

programme.desc: Lucas encourages a drunken artist charged with murder to use his talents to identify the true killer.

programme.desc: Lucas unmasks a killer posing as a door-to-door seed salesman.

programme.desc: Lucas and Marshall Torrance run into trouble while transporting a captured killer back to face trial.

programme.desc: Lucas looks for answers when recovering alcoholic Micah Torrence returns to the bottle and turns in his badge.

programme.desc: Two pranksters write away for a mail-order bride, using Lucas's name.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting a deaf teenage girl and keeping everyone off the father's place for a day or two. Although initially bored, Josh starts to develop a relationship with the friendly girl.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A broke Josh is hired by a fearful man to help him elope with his sweetheart, Jane, the daughter of a local rancher. The girl's father is vehemently opposed to the marriage.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh takes a job protecting an express office employee who stole $10,000 and wants to return it before it's discovered missing. However, he had an accomplice and does not know where the accomplice is.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A Japanese woman travels to the U.S. to find a man who proposed to her and hires Josh to find him since no one will help her. Josh is confronted by the Japanese man to whom she had been promised.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in town thinking the sheriff summoned him to go after a man. Instead, a woman wants Josh to bring in the man, her wanted husband, alive, so he can prove self defense.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides to Barney Durant's horse business right after Barney pushes his son to leave. When Josh's prisoners escape taking 2 horses from his horse trader friend, he helps in tracking them down.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in outlaw Carlos Domingo, but he has to be released when the witness against him is killed. Josh concocts a surprise witness to testify against the notorious killer - his own mother.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is sent for by the desperate men of Coronado. He is hired to convince the women of the town to come back to their men when they leave demanding that all towns men give up their guns for good.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh brings in a man wanted for robbery but loses his reward. A well meaning doctor pays an innocent man to take the blame for his son, but the son sets out to kill the man to make sure he never tells

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh arrives in a town for rest just as the local bank has been robbed. A traveling medicine man knows the whereabouts of the suspect and wants Josh to help because he thinks the suspect is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A widow wants to hire/propose to Josh so she doesn't lose custody of her son. Josh served under her husband in the war. His mother now is trying to steal her grandson to take over the family fortune.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When Randall has a sheriff bed a prisoner, the man's gang kidnaps the sheriff and two others and threatens to kill one per day until the man is freed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: In Mexico, Josh is hired to protect a man and his pregnant wife from his the villagers who are angered when he refuses the town healing woman or "witch" from being present when his wife gives birth.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: After Josh takes the task of finding a man and his wife's pet ewe, he becomes the butt of many jokes while cattlemen nearly hang him when he mentions sheep. His only clue is a gold bell the ewe wore.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Girl in Gold Boots" (1968) Crime drama; A draft dodger works as a janitor in Hollywood while his girlfriend goes into go-go dancing.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Women of the Prehistoric Planet" (1966) Science fiction. Alien astronauts land on a strange place, but it's only the beginning of Earth. With Wendell Corey, Keith Larsen, John Agar.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: In Indestructible Man, a violent criminal named Butcher Benson is executed and becomes indestructible when he’s brought back to life . Butcher seeks revenge against those who caused his execution.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Werewolf" (1996) Horror. Members of an isolated desert community become beasts when the moon is full.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A Russian hero plots an invasion against the Mongols in The Sword and the Dragon (1956). Mike and the Bots create their own topical comedy show, reenact the table cloth scene from the movie, and try their hand at playing Dungeons and Dragons.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Fugitive Alien" (1986) Science fiction. Wolf Raiders from Valnastar attack Earth; one, wanted for treason, becomes a space loner named Ken. With Tatsuya Azuma, Miyuki Tanigawa, Joe Shishido.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: The crew watches "Track of the Moon Beast," where a New Mexico mineralogist is transformed into a mindless humanoid-lizard monster after being hit by a meteor.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: Santo invents a time machine that gets him embroiled in the machinations of Dracula.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: A couple of slackers stumble across a cult of monsters at a carnival and becomes a killing zombie.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: After plunging the frazzled crew into a world of prophecies, gnarly spiders and scantily clad warriors, Kinga unveils her next diabolical plan.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "High School Big Shot" (1959) Crime drama. An academic achiever falls for a girl who leads him astray; with Tom Pittman.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Amazing Transparent Man" (1960) Science Fiction. A crook decides to rob a bank instead of working for the mad scientist who made him invisible.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "The Lost Continent" (1951) Science fiction. Air Force pilots searching for a rocket crash-land on an island of dinosaurs. With Cesar Romero, Hillary Brooke, Chick Chandler.

programme.title: RiffTrax: Icebreaker
programme.desc: The RiffTrax crew hits the slopes for this Die Hard on Skis with Sean Astin, a delightfully hammy Bruce Campbell and terrorists with a stolen nuke.

programme.title: Mystery Science Theater 3000
programme.desc: "Gamera vs. Gaos" (1967) Science fiction. The fire-breathing flying turtle fights a flying fox-thing that shoots laser beams orally. With Kojiro Hongo, Kichijiro Ueda, Hisayuki Abe.

programme.title: Backlot
programme.desc: Joel and the rest of the team discuss the Satellite of Love crew.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A daughter wants to surprise her dad with breakfast in bed but finds him unresponsive. His family is convinced they know what killed him, but Dr. G must let the evidence speak for itself.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 45-year-old Natalie, who's visiting her sister from Australia, is found dead the morning after a heated argument with her estranged brother-in-law. Dr. G suspects foul play and she must race against the clock to give the police and Natalie's family the answers they need.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Even with many leads, including an insulin overdose, a tooth infection and chronic lupus, the pieces don't add up in the case of a woman's death. Will Dr. G be able to uncover the truth?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 69-year-old widower, Ernesto Vasquez is found dead on his porch with a loaded gun, a knife and three empty pill bottles.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When an infant dies under mysterious circumstances, the young parents are prime suspects. Dr. G discovers several clues that bolster the child abuse theory, but the case is not clear cut.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An elderly woman is driving when she's overcome with shooting pains and crashes her car. She's rushed to the hospital, but the doctors find nothing wrong. Can Dr. G find the cause of death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must figure out if a man died as a result of his infected stab wound or if his history of drug abuse was the culprit.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In a bizarre scene, 44-year-old Olga Petrova is found severely burnt in her home after a heated argument with her fiancé. Police want to question him and find out what happened, but he's nowhere to be found.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must determine if a teen boy died by taking his own life, but the autopsy leads to a more shocking and tragic conclusion.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A 71-year-old man wakes in the middle of the night, gasping for air. Paramedics rush to save him, but it's all in vain: he's dead by the time they arrive. What caused his death?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A woman fears the worst when her aunt stops answering her calls. When her greatest fear is confirmed, Dr. G must determine one thing: was this a fatal fall?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G must decide if she can perform a successful autopsy without the deceased's organs. As she ponders the decision, we are given a rare glimpse into a different side of Dr. G's job.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Leo Guzman falls off a ladder while painting a house. At first, his death seems to be an open-and-shut case but, as the autopsy unfolds, Dr. G believes there may be more to this case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Both natural disease and sport's injury are likely suspects in Eric Brody's death. But then Dr. G learns that he was treated with antibiotics for a spider bite prior to his death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Keith Douglas is met with a barrage of bullets as he opens his door. The police are looking to Dr. G for hard evidence to link certain suspects to the murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A teen is eating breakfast when his dad starts stabbing himself. As the investigation unfolds, police begin to doubt the story. Dr. G must determine if this was a suicide or a murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G has a challenge on her hands: a victim's body spent days decaying before it was found, and decomposition could get in the way of her investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: All circumstances point to foul play in the case of a dead hunter and the police fear that a killer is on the loose. Dr. G must provide them with answers before there are more victims.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An otherwise healthy child had been complaining of stomach pains. Could the medicine his mother had recently given him be to blame? Or could his death be from something more sinister?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A teacher excuses himself for a nap after dinner, but he never wakes up. The man has a complex medical history that leads Dr. G on a hunt for an explanation to his mysterious death.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G, along with the National Transportation Safety Board, to piece together how and why a plane crashed, leaving the pilot dead.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police discover the dead body of Andrew Hopper clutching a syringe and covered with blood. The body is in Dr. G's hands, as are the clues to solving the case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A florist meets with clients for an upcoming wedding, but she suddenly collapses to the floor. With no apparent cause of death, Dr. G worries that this case may go unsolved.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: When Dr. G receives Lea Conrad's body, she suspects the woman may have died from an antihistamine overdose. Then, Dr. G learns that Lea was being treated for lupus.

programme.desc: When a man with a hand injury passes out from abdominal pain, tests lead to a shocking discovery.

programme.desc: When a rapidly spreading virus turns animals of a safari park into the undead, those left inside must stop them before they zombify the whole city.

programme.desc: When a solitary and strange adolescent boy makes a disturbing discovery in the depths of the forest, he wreaks vengeance on those who harass him.

programme.title: Curtains

programme.desc: Decades-old found footage involving three astronauts and an abandoned, secret NASA mission reveals why the U.S. has never returned to the moon.

programme.title: Cut and Run
programme.desc: A determined TV news reporter and her cameraman discover the murderous plot of a drug cartel leader who has gone rogue deep in the jungle.

programme.desc: Forced by desperate circumstances, two sisters rob a bank and are given instructions to check an old vault, where something dark resides.

programme.title: Megaboa
programme.desc: On a trip to Colombia, a group of college students encounter a sixty-foot boa constrictor, hungry for blood.

programme.title: Prom Night
programme.desc: Six years after a tragic accident, a masked killer hunts the teens responsible, turning their high school prom into a night of terror.

programme.title: My Friend Dahmer

programme.title: The Legend of Bloody Jack
programme.desc: Campfire urban legend Bloody Jack comes to life when one of his kin resurrects him from the dead.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on the plants that need winter protection and thinks ahead to colourful spring bouquets. The glory of summer may be over in most gardens, but Carol goes to Worcestershire in search of some autumn colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow Monty is planting bulbs in pots and around the garden for an explosion of spring colour. Carol Klein travels to Yorkshire where she takes a close look at the enormous colour range and form of a late season perennial, the salvia. Mark Lane is in Oxfordshire looking at how ornamental grasses can be used in planting design to create exciting combinations.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the cottage garden, Monty is moving a rose which has outgrown its space and in the vegetable garden he gives advice on what to plant now for spring. He also finds out more about the mysterious world of earthworms and discovers why they are vital for the garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Charge your glasses as Joe Swift visits a `drinkable' allotment in London where much of the produce is grown to make beer, wine and cider. In the first of a five-part series about botany, Carol Klein looks at the capsules of potential that herald the start and end of most plants' lives: seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Kew on a Plate
programme.desc: The end of the year at Kew is fast approaching, winter is setting in, but some crops positively love the cold and Raymond learns how brassicas cope in this frosty season. Kate visits Kew's Millennium Seed Bank.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty expands the planting on the mound, gathers self-sown seedlings and prepares for a summer display in the cottage garden. Meanwhile, Nick Bailey travels to Devon to explore a stunning garden that combines historic charm with modern garden design.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardeners' World comes from the first big flower show of the season: the RHS Malvern Spring Festival. Arit Anderson and Joe Swift discover the newest varieties of plants and flowers that are hot off the potting bench.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy moving his tender succulents outdoors and makes a start on planting up his new cut flower beds. Plus, in North Yorkshire, Frances Tophill visits the gardens at Newby Hall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summer feasts in mind, Monty reveals a new outdoor eating area he has been working on and gets started by planting up a delicious pot of herbs. Now that any threat of frost has past, he also plants out tender plants to give months of colour.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summer around the corner, Monty reveals his plans for planting up pots in his cottage garden, shares tips on how to start your own topiary from scratch, and in the veg garden, gets some pumpkins in the ground.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty's in the jewel garden showing which plants need protection from the elements now and which ones can be left until after the first frosts. He also plants out berried shrubs to help feed wildlife in the winter, harvests pumpkins and shows how to make use of fallen autumnal leaves.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the second of her films about botany, Carol Klein goes underground to unravel the mysteries of roots and why they are so important to the health of our plants. Joe Swift meets fashion icon, Dame Zandra Rhodes, to explore how the flowers she likes to grow have influenced her designs over the years.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With Halloween just round the corner, Monty Don is harvesting his pumpkins and showing how to store them for roasts, soups and stews in the coming months. Joe Swift visits a high end garden in West London to get some tips on how clever landscaping and the use of lighting can turn a small space into an outdoor room which can be used all year round.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill and the team continue to celebrate the joy that the gardening year brings; Rachel de Thame visits Anglesey Abbey; Arit Anderson discovers how rewilding can increase biodiversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets involved in more seasonal tasks at Longmeadow. Carol Klein celebrates the spring highlights at Beth Chatto's Gardens in Essex, and Toby Buckland is in Cornwall to meet a gardener who fell out of love with gardening.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the clocks going forward this weekend, there's an extra hour of gardening to enjoy. Monty makes the most of this as he begins to sow dahlia seeds for summer flowers, reveals a new project and shows what to plant now in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob paints a thawing landscape.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: With guest artist Steve Ross.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: In an almost watercolor appearance, Bob Ross paints this amazing secluded waterfall masterpiece with interesting tree and rock formations.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob paints a path in the woods.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Hidden far from the highways of the South are lovely wetlands teaming with moss-clad trees and birds; Bob Ross shares a rare glimpse of beauty!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: From a quiet spot by this smooth-stoned river, join Bob Ross for a very, very distant view of a lovely snow-covered mountain.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates a moment in time as the sea finds itself in one of nature's sudden cloudbursts; experience another oval masterpiece!

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross takes us home to the farm -- a big red barn and long rickety wooden fence - capturing our very vivid childhood memories.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Powerful clouds, rolling hills and winding river waters -- Bob Ross creates this masterpiece using only his special painting knife.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross takes us deep into the southeastern peninsula to create a beautiful scene with still blue waters and bright green mossy trees.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Evening sky sets in, giving way to a perfect glow -- watch a black canvas come to life under the magic brushes of Bob Ross.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a lonely winter cabin.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a quiet lake.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a nature scene.

programme.title: Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob paints a rugged mountain shelter.

programme.desc: Visiting artist Ben Stahl uses a more traditional painting method to bring out the coy loveliness of a little girl.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross' painting technique is at its best as he shows a rugged group of mountains peering down upon nature's lovely greenery.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: A real Bob Ross classic - the majestic snow covered mountain, rolling foothills, leafy trees and bushes and serene lake.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: The undaunted splendor of sky, trees and lake has never been more beautifully portrayed than in this joyful Bob Ross creation.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: The mountains and the sky sing in harmony as Bob Ross' brushes tell a story of breathtaking hue and depth.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross uses beautiful shades of green that burst forth in this exciting and realistic display of nature's wonder.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross finds a barely visible lake being hugged by snowy mountains and some of nature's finest greenery.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross will enchant you as he captures, on the canvas, a bright and cheery mountain scene right out of your dreams.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Bob Ross creates a gentle brook flowing from one oval to another, under the protective branches and foliage of stately birch trees.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Enjoy this fascinating experience of watching Bob Ross bring these deep dark woods alive; incredible magic on a partial black canvas.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross
programme.desc: Travel with Bob Ross into an evening display of glowing, magnificent setting sun. Another unique oval painting you'll have to see.

programme.title: The Joy of Painting With Bob Ross

We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: With the drastic changes in the Southern California fishery over the past several years, it has been easy to get fixated on targeting large Bluefin tuna and going all out on what many have coined "big fish" fishing. On this episode Ali and Rush take advantage of the many other opportunities this time of year has to offer and switch focus back to the basics, targeting smaller yellowfin, bluefin, and mahi on bait.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Thinking about a travel fishing trip of a lifetime? Check out what the participants of the first Local Knowledge-Casa Vieja group trip have to say about our favorite lodge in this special edition episode!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: What do you do when you fish for a living and get a day off? You go fishing! With weather on the forecast and a last minute cancelation, Rush calls long time friend Capt. Tony "Key Limey" Murphy to see what will bite before the cold front hits Key West.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: It might be cold and windy, but if you have trust in your guide the result could be an epic day of fishing! Rush steps up to the challenge and puts Ali on an incredible bite of mutton snapper while also checking another species off of Ali's bucket list!

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA and longtime fishing buddy Dave Denkert get together for a Flamingo Slam.

programme.title: Flats Class

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the scenic Low country of South Carolina for part one of an epic two-part redfish adventure.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The boys are back in the Florida Keys to kick off the new season. Ali gets to check out Rush's new digs at the Ocean's Edge Resort and take a ride on the new, Mercury powered SeaVee 34Oz. Rush has been dialing in his new live bait set up and has a few freshies to hopefully feed to a hungry wahoo. And if that doesn't work, there's always something great to catch in the Florida Keys.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: In the first installment of this two part series, the guys are bringing it back to where it all began for Local Knowledge. Ali and Rush head to Baja California Sur to meet up with Julio Meza and friends in the towns of La Bocana and Abreojos to target large Gulf and Broomtail grouper in shallow water. This time around the crew trades the stressful drive with boat in tow for a quick flight right into grouper country.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Ice fishing Crappies at night with Freedom Baitz Bonita Minnow!

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Despite adverse conditions, Capt. Jonathan Moss and long time friend, Capt. Adam Whitson, are heading out on the water in search of the Crystal River Inshore Slam.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Joined by PCB’s Artificial Reef Coordinator Erin Graham Capt Justin fish previously dropped reefs before sinking the famed BLACK PEARL from iconic films right off Panama City Beach, FL.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin and Meredith return to the chase after taking a lesson from finicky tarpon. This time, they pay close attention to how hooks and presentations affect their odds of a strike.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Todd Jones jumps on Justin’s boat for a sight fishing dream day. After success along the beach, they turn to handlining for Goliath grouper and witness the amazing survival saga of the world’s luckiest fish.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Justin entices a friend to play hooky from work to set hooks offshore on a perfect “locals” day. The only thing better than the weather was the dinner they caught and cooked.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "Here at Huckberry, we believe that style isn’t defined solely by what you wear — it’s personified in your morning rituals, your bookshelves and music library, the furniture you choose to spend your waking hours in, and the gear closet that powers your passions and pursuits. Style doesn’t end with your closet, it sparks to life there.On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas’ own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin’s first suburb. It’s a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself."

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Meet Luke DiTella—once a pro surfer, now the founder of Frank August whiskey, and an all-around Renaissance man. Whether it's barrels at a Jersey beach break or barrels of aged whiskey, Luke knows how to turn life into an art form. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, we take a deep dive into Luke’s world at his coastal haven in Monmouth Beach, New Jersey. It’s a place where the salty sea air meets the rich aroma of aged whiskey—a home that’s as rugged yet refined as the man himself. Luke opens his doors to share tales of surfing glory, entrepreneurial grit, and the beautiful chaos of fatherhood (spoiler: they don't care about your design aesthetic).

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: On Huckberry Homes, we’ll be tapping into the most inspiring members of the Huckberry community to offer an inside peek into how they’ve crafted the place they call home. We will showcase everything from cold plunges to vinyl listening rooms, home gyms and offices, and other tools that inspire creativity and high-performing lives.For our first entry, we turned to Austin, Texas’ own Scott Ballew. Our good buddy, Scott, is a filmmaker and songwriter who owns a Bohemian bungalow in the heart of Austin’s first suburb. It’s a home now that serves as a creative incubator, gathering place, hideaway, recording studio -- and maybe, as a personal shrine of a man curated by the man himself.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: Dean Petty is a man of many titles: surfer, carpenter, restaurant owner, coffee roaster. In this episode of Huckberry Homes, he takes us to "Camp Bueno", a minimalist surf sanctuary in Cow Bay, Nova Scotia, he built with his own two hands (and a lot of help from his friends). From a concrete kitchen countertop that took days to grind to perfection, to a barn staircase that turned into a viral meme, it's a place you won’t find anywhere else in the world.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker fishes out of Hawks Cay with fellow Duck Key resident Captain Ariel Medero catching Blackfin Tunas and big Queen Snappers.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger chase the full moon Wahoo bite fishing out of Plantation Boat Mart.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker heads swordfishing out of Hawks Cay with his friend, retired WWE wrestler Travis Tomko.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Ariel Medero fish with David Moss from the Nature Conservancy out of Hawks Cay sampling the bottom fishing and deep dropping. In between the action they learn about the Nature Conservancy’s mission to promote sustainable and transparent fishing practices.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in Plantation Boat Mart’s new 36’ Invincible with some muttons for dinner and an epic shallow water sailfish double.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger fish with Daiwa’s Marc Mills out of Plantation Boat Mart trying out all of Daiwa’s new jigging equipment.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Huckberry's flagship adventure series is back in Japan and the DIRT crew is hungry as ever for adventure. This time, they’re diving into the Kansai region—where millennia-old traditions flow from the shore of Lake Biwa to surf breaks on the coast. Chef Coleman Griffin gives them a taste of the deep cultural immersion that inspires his culinary practice, from chef knives descended from samurai swords to fermented carp that went on to spawn sushi. And turns out, the perfect meal does exist, and the crew knew it as soon as they had a bite of their final omakase.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Guadalajara’s heritage runs deep. On the DIRT crew’s latest adventure, they explored the region’s rich history from volcanic highlands to secret surf coves. Chefs Xrysw Ruelas and Óscar Segundo sent Josh and co. to load up on locally grown coffee, spearfish between catching waves, and follow freshly harvested agave on its journey to becoming tequila. After learning the ropes of Mexico’s national sport, Charreria, and hitting up a Lucha Libre match, all the local flavors came together in a feast backed by thousands of years of tradition. There really is something special in the soil here.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: Across the country, deer season to many Americans is a rite of passage. For generations, Winchester has been the trusted ammunition choice for hunters…and it’s been a decade since the game-changing Deer Season XP whitetail line was introduced. In this episode, we’ll celebrate the many successes by Team Winchester hunters in the field during whitetail and mule deer firearm seasons across the United States. GUESTS: Melissa Bachman (Team Winchester) Mark Drury (Team Winchester) Nikki Boxler (Team Winchester) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester) Jason Gilbertson (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Overview: The mission of Shoot United is to be a content resource for millions of shooters and a place where people can learn, build confidence and find ways to participate. Through films, educational videos and articles, SU has impacted countless shooters all over the world. In this episode, join Shoot United Ambassadors as they inspire and educate through a series of instructional videos and stories in pistol, self-defense, trap and skeet and sporting clays. GUESTS: Thea Van Sync (Team Winchester) Callie Farill (Team Winchester) Becky Yackley (Team Winchester) Theo Ribbs (Team Winchester) Jessica Hook (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Illinois isn’t the first state you think about when it comes to waterfowl, but the Wentz Brothers have dialed in some honey holes over the years. On this episode, a slew of waterfowl experts put to the test some of the newest Winchester waterfowl ammunition during the great migration of the Mississippi Flyway in early December. We’ll also head north to the shores of Kodiak Island, Alaska with Chris and Casey Keefer as they push the limits of Winchester’s new Last Call Double Shot on fast-ripping sea ducks.GUESTS: Zach Wentz (Team Winchester) Nathan Robinson (Winchester Ammunition) Ryan Swaner (Winchester Repeating Arms) Chris Jennings (Ducks Unlimited) Mike Brasher (Ducks Unlimited) Scott Olmsted (American Hunter) Travis Hall (Field & Stream) Chris Keefer (Team Winchester) Casey Keefer (Team Winchester)

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Col. Nick Nichols from Folds of Honor and Olympic skeet shooter Dania Vizzi are both proud Americans who have represented their country overseas. Col. Nichols commanded the air in the cockpit of a fighter jet for countless missions during his seven combat tours and Dania donned the stars and bars proudly on her shooting vest as an Olympian in Paris. Now with Winchesters in hand, both are in the Midwest whitetail woods during late November during the back end of the rut hoping to connect on a Missouri monarch.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: With the drought ending and rain headed their way, the crew hunts the final days of the first split in Bayou Black with new friends Jesse Griffiths and Dirk Sorrells.

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: The second split is here, and the crew decides to try their luck at historic Old Hickory in Lacour, Louisiana. Ducks, deer, and mouth-watering meals are all on the menu.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: The "Trained Assassins" are back and it’s turkey season in the Midwest. In this first episode, Slade, Blake, and Ryan start in Missouri, run into some trouble, but end up getting it done on the first leg of the 2024 turkey tour.

programme.title: HUnting Land Man

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchester’s best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. We’ll also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Hard Truths of Conservation
programme.desc: Dan Cabela is on a mission to better understand how wild-harvested protein contributes economically and culturally to society in North America. Join him as he learns more about the Wild Harvest Initiative and sets out to harvest his own food for the freezer.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.title: TRP
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.

programme.title: TRP
